mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Our Mission is to fully recreate Austria, Switzerland and Liechtenstein at a 1:1 scale in the video game Minecraft. One block in Minecraft equals one meter. To achieve this almost impossible goal, anyone is able to join us as Builder and contribute to the largest and most expansive build project to ever have been attempted in Minecraft.

server.title: Our Server
server.description: Once you join our server network with the IP mc.alps-bte.com in the Minecraft version 1.12.2-1.17, you have two options: Either start building right away using the "Plot System" or visit already built areas by joining the "Terra Server". The "Plot System" is the easiest and fastest way to apply as an official Builder. If you are accepted into the Build Team as a Builder, you can build whatever you want on our open world "Terra Server".

how.title: How we do it
how.description: We use various publicly accessible geoinformation systems, LiDAR, 360 images and drone footage to recreate any structure with the highest degree of accuracy and detail as it is possible within Minecraft. Since building at off-angles is quite different from classic Minecraft building, we also have developed a large variety of tools to make it easier to get started. Furthermore, to overcome the Minecraft height limitation we use clever server side modifications like "Cubic Chunks".

description.title: The Project
description.description: Alps BTE was founded on 06.04.2020 and is an open build team and subproject of BuildTheEarth.net. With members mostly from Austria, Switzerland and Liechtenstein, we are dedicated to the detailed 1:1 scale replication of the three countries in the video game Minecraft. With almost 400 international builders and 1800+ Discord members, we reconstruct entire cities, villages and landscapes in Minecraft version 1.12.

description.title: The Technology
description.description: “Mods” - short for “Modifications” - are community-created and -maintained, i.e. unofficial additions the the source code of a video game, which open up entirely new possibilities for their users. Essential parts of our project are two such mods: Cubic Chunks splits the maps of the video game into three-dimensional loading units, which remove the technical limitations caused by the unmodified “Vanilla”-Minecraft, especially the height limit of 256 blocks, and are thus a prerequisite for the proper functioning of all processes based on it. Terra++ can - thanks to Cubic Chunks - generate an accurate map projection of the terrain within a Minecraft map using OpenStreetMap altitude data. The mod also allows us to integrate altitude data of other kinds, e.g. LiDAR data collected by the Swiss Federal Office of Topography for Switzerland and Liechtenstein, as well as LiDAR collected by the Austrian GlSes into the system. Due to this, our projection is much more precise and tedious manual work to adjust the terrain is a thing of the past. In addition, there are a variety of other modifications and plugins that provide additional support for our builders. Our Developer-Team is also always working behind the scenes on new innovations for our network - for example, the plot system added for our first anniversary, which allows even inexperienced members to participate in the project, even without any mods, thus making it easier for them to join our project. Furthermore, our developers also take care of routine work on the server in order to provide our members with an experience that is as free of disturbances and lag as possible. They are in active contact with our international colleagues if more comprehensive technical questions arise.

description.title: The Community
description.description: Alps BTE is known for it’s helpful and committed community. The challenging recruitment process for our Builders is unattractive for trolls and scammers and keeps the project free of discrimination, spam, griefing and fraud. It also guarantees a minimum level of building skill. The supposed barriers in our linguistic landscape are rarely a problem. Instead, a very friendly community has developed, which results in many new friendships, side projects as well as meetups of the members.

description.title: The Team
description.description: The Alps BTE “staff team” consists of numerous committed people who volunteer to help Alps BTE growing. They make sure our builders, as well as visitors, have a smooth and uncomplicated experience. Furthermore, they also do PR work and raise attention to our project all over the world. Below is a breakdown of the different sub-teams of our build team management: Managers: They manage the project. Each Manager is responsible for his/her own sub-team. They take care of basic decisions and hiring new staff members. Helpers: They support the Managers in their tasks and take care of their own areas of competence (e.g. event planning and moderation). Reviewers: They are responsible for reviewing applications and submitted plots. Developers: They take care of all technical aspects of our project. For more information, see chapter “The Technology”. Public Relations: They represent Alps BTE in public and take care of our social media. Furthermore, they translate texts into several languages, conduct interviews and handle press inquiries. Architects: They take care of creating new plots to build on. They also support the helpers in event preparation.

gallery.title: Gallery
gallery.description: This page shows a collection of some of our building efforts. The content will be updated continuously. High resolution pictures for news coverage can be downloaded here as well.

downloads.title: Downloads
downloads.description: To support journalists in their work, we have made official press photos and information on Alps BTE available here for download. You are welcome to use this information for non-commercial publications without contacting us. Editorial use is permitted. In case of publication, we kindly request that a proof copy be sent to our press office.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.description: Here you can find frequently asked questions about Alps BTE and the tools we use. If you have any questions that are not answered here, please contact us

application.title: Application
application.description: This is an overview on how to become a "Builder" - a member of our build team. For further information join our Discord. If you want an in-depth explanation on how to apply, watch our tutorial video down below.

discord.title: Discord
discord.description: We use Discord for coordinating the project and for communication between our members. Download the free messenger and join our Alps BTE Discord-Server. Read through the information channels to get used to the project and get in touch with our community.

plotSystem.title: Plot System
plotSystem.description: Join our Minecraft server with the versions 1.12.2-1.17 and start building with the "Plot System" by right-clicking the nether star in your inventory. Choose the city you want to build in and get started. Once you have submitted two plots, you can apply as a Builder.

applicationForm.title: Application Form
applicationForm.description: Go to https://buildtheearth.net/bte-alps, click "Apply" and fill out the form. Add the IDs of your constructed plots so that we can confirm you are able to build in BTE. For starting off we highly recommend our Builders Guide series on our YouTube channel which covers every aspect of building in BTE.

becomingBuilder.title: Becoming a Builder
becomingBuilder.description: Once you have sent off your form, it will be reviewed in less than 48 hours by one of our Reviewers. Meanwhile you can download the official Modpack - a modification of the game - that is crucial for building on the open-world "Terra Server". If you have been accepted into the team you get the "Builder" role and are now free to build wherever you want in Austria, Switzerland and Liechtenstein.

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: Alps BTE is an independent subsidiary organisation of the Build The Earth project. It was founded in March 2020 and aims to recreate Austria, Switzerland and Liechtenstein at a 1:1 scale in the block game Minecraft.
